ground_truth: Fatigue overwhelms him, but he continues writing. In the driveway, 7-year-old Evan plays with CRICKETT, a frisky cocker spaniel puppy. Andrea, wearing a mechanic's jumpsuit, works impatiently on the carburetor of a Toyota Celica as Evan pets the dog and watches his mother work. Evan impatiently watches Andrea turn the bolt, but the carburetor will not set properly. Evan blows Andrea a kiss goodbye and runs into the school. As Andrea pulls away, MRS. BOSWELL, 35, taps the car window. The classroom is filled with screaming, running children when Mrs. Boswell enters with Andrea and immediately calls out to TOMMY, a tough seven-year-old kid who swings a whiffle bat at LENNY, now seven, a sniffling, chubby kid. Evan is surprised to see his mother enter with Mrs. Boswell but continues playing with Kayleigh, now seven, a quiet, sweet-looking girl. Mrs. Boswell leads Andrea over to the teacher's desk, opens the bottom drawer, and pulls out a drawing. Andrea turns to stone when she sees it; the drawing shows a child holding a bloody knife while standing on a heap of dead bodies, and some of the corpses have been cut open with surprisingly anatomically correct insides. Andrea sees Evan playing with Lenny, harmless as a bunny, and struggles to control her concern, visibly shaken now. Andrea leads Evan into Dr. Redfield's office where Evan busily writes in his new black-marble mead comp book. Meanwhile, Andrea speaks into the phone as she pours Lucky Charms into a cereal bowl for Evan, hangs up, walks into the next room, grabs the pocketbook off the coffee table, and heads back into the kitchen, dropping her purse in shock when she sees Evan, in the doorway, expressionless and holding a large BUTCHER KNIFE by his side. Evan sees her but remains expressionless, seems stunned to find himself holding the knife, and drops it. Andrea, still shaken, drops Evan off at the house of GEORGE MILLER, 35, a handsome athletic man with an infectious smile, who approaches the car and opens the door for Evan. Andrea writes nervously on a piece of paper as Evan gets out, and Evan nods and sticks his arms straight up in the air. The rec-room/basement. Miller's camera lens and finally to Kayleigh, whose ashen face trembles slightly. Panic spreads across Evan's face. Dr. Redfield leads Evan inside, where Evan takes a seat at a long rectangular table, his eyes fixated on the door on the other side of the room. Finally, a dark figure can be seen through the opaque glass; JASON, thirty and haggard-looking, enters the room as Evan's eyes fixate on the leg-restraints and handcuffs that hinder Jason's movement.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Despite overwhelming fatigue, he continues writing. Outside, 7-year-old Evan plays with CRICKETT, a frisky cocker spaniel. Andrea, in a mechanic's jumpsuit, works on a Toyota Celica carburetor as Evan pets the dog. Impatiently watching, Evan blows Andrea a kiss and heads to school. Andrea drives off and MRS. BOSWELL, 35, taps the window. In class, Mrs. Boswell arrives with Andrea, immediately addressing TOMMY, a tough seven-year-old swinging a bat at LENNY, a sniffling kid. Surprised to see his mother, Evan continues playing with Kayleigh, a quiet girl. Mrs. Boswell shows Andrea a disturbing drawing of a child with a bloody knife. Shaken, Andrea sees Evan playing harmlessly with Lenny. In Dr. Redfield's office, Evan writes in his comp book while Andrea pours Lucky Charms, hangs up the phone, and drops her purse in shock seeing Evan with a large butcher knife. Evan, stunned, drops the knife. Andrea, still shaken, takes Evan to GEORGE MILLER, 35, an athletic man with a friendly smile. Evan exits the car, arms up, while Andrea writes nervously. In the rec-room, panic spreads across Evan's face. Dr. Redfield leads Evan to a table, his eyes on the door. A dark figure, JASON, thirty and worn, enters. Evan fixates on the restraints hindering Jason's movement.

Evan watches, blows her a goodbye kiss, and runs into school. As Andrea leaves, MRS. BOSWELL, 35, taps the window. Inside the classroom, pandemonium reigns. Mrs. Boswell enters with Andrea, calling TOMMY, a tough kid swinging a whiffle bat at LENNY, a sniffling, chubby child. Evan, surprised to see Andrea, resumes playing with Kayleigh, a sweet girl. Mrs. Boswell shows Andrea a disturbing drawing from the teacher's desk, depicting a child with a bloody knife amid anatomically detailed corpses. Shaken, Andrea sees Evan with Lenny, innocent and harmless. She takes Evan to Dr. Redfield's office, where he writes in a notebook. Andrea, pouring Evan cereal, is shocked to see him expressionless with a large BUTCHER KNIFE. He drops it, stunned. Andrea, still shaken, drops Evan at GEORGE MILLER's house, a charming man. Evan exits the car, and Andrea writes nervously. The rec-room. Miller films Kayleigh, her face trembling. Panic spreads across Evan. Dr. Redfield escorts Evan to a room, fixated on the door. JASON, thirty, enters, and Evan's eyes lock on his restraints.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Fatigue completely and utterly overwhelms him, yet despite his exhaustion, he diligently continues writing. Meanwhile, in the driveway of their home, energetic little seven-year-old Evan happily plays with CRICKETT, a lively and spirited cocker spaniel puppy, his loyal companion. Nearby, Andrea, who is dressed in a mechanic's jumpsuit, works with visible impatience and frustration on the carburetor of a Toyota Celica. As Evan lovingly pets the playful dog, he also watches his mother work with keen eyes, observing her every move. Evan, feeling a bit impatient himself, watches closely as Andrea turns the bolt with determination, but to their disappointment, the carburetor just will not set properly. He lovingly blows Andrea a kiss goodbye and then dashes off into the school building. 

As Andrea is about to drive away, MRS. BOSWELL, a 35-year-old woman, taps gently on the car window to get her attention. Inside the classroom, the scene is chaotic as it is brimming with children who are both screaming and running around wildly. When Mrs. Boswell enters, accompanied by Andrea, she immediately calls out to TOMMY, a tough, resilient seven-year-old boy, who is swinging a whiffle bat with determination at LENNY, a sniffly, chubby kid also seven years old. Evan is taken by surprise to see his mother walk in with Mrs. Boswell, but he decides to continue his playtime with Kayleigh, a sweet-natured, quiet girl of about the same age. Mrs. Boswell guides Andrea to the teacher's desk, opens the bottom drawer, and takes out a drawing. The moment Andrea lays eyes on it, she freezes like a statue; the drawing depicts a child holding a bloody knife while standing ominously atop a heap of lifeless bodies, some disturbingly cut open to reveal their surprisingly anatomically correct insides. 

Astounded, Andrea looks at Evan, who is innocently playing with Lenny, as harmless as can be, and she struggles to keep her concern under control, visibly shaken by now. Later, Andrea escorts Evan into Dr. Redfield's office, where Evan is busily writing in his new black-marble mead composition book with focused attention. In the meantime, Andrea speaks into the phone, all the while pouring Lucky Charms cereal into a bowl for Evan. After hanging up, she walks into the next room, retrieves the pocketbook from the coffee table, and heads back into the kitchen. She drops her purse in shock upon seeing Evan standing there, expressionless, in the doorway and holding a large BUTCHER KNIFE by his side. Evan sees his mother but remains expressionless, appearing stunned to find himself grasping the knife, and subsequently, he drops it. 

Still deeply shaken, Andrea drops Evan off at the house of GEORGE MILLER, a charming and athletic 35-year-old man with an infectious smile. He approaches the car with a friendly demeanor and courteously opens the door for Evan. Andrea, with evident nervousness, writes something quickly on a piece of paper as Evan gets out of the car. Evan, in response, nods and raises his arms straight up in the air. Inside the rec-room/basement, the focus shifts to Miller's camera lens and eventually to Kayleigh, whose ashen face shows slight trembling. Panic begins to spread unmistakably across Evan's face. Dr. Redfield then leads Evan inside, where he takes a seat at a long rectangular table, his eyes intently fixed on the door located on the opposite side of the room. At last, a dark silhouette is visible through the opaque glass; JASON, a thirty-year-old man with a haggard appearance, enters the room. Evan's eyes are now fixated on the leg-restraints and handcuffs that hinder Jason's movement.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Fatigue, in its entirety, completely overwhelms and consumes him. Yet, despite the all-encompassing exhaustion that threatens to overpower him, he diligently perseveres with the task of writing. Meanwhile, just outside in the driveway of their cozy home, energetic and enthusiastic little seven-year-old Evan is happily engrossed in play with CRICKETT, a lively and spirited cocker spaniel puppy who is his loyal and delightful companion. Nearby, Andrea, dressed in the practical attire of a mechanic's jumpsuit, works with visible impatience and growing frustration on the intricacies of a Toyota Celica's carburetor. As Evan affectionately pets the playful dog, he maintains a watchful gaze on his mother, keenly observing her every move with his attentive eyes. Feeling a bit impatient himself, Evan closely watches as Andrea tackles the stubborn bolt with determination, only to face disappointment when the carburetor refuses to set properly. He lovingly blows Andrea a goodbye kiss and dashes off energetically into the school building.

As Andrea is about to drive away, MRS. BOSWELL, a poised 35-year-old woman, gently taps on the car window to capture her attention. Within the chaotic classroom, a scene brimming with children who are both screaming and running around wildly unfolds. Just as Mrs. Boswell enters, accompanied by Andrea, she immediately calls out to TOMMY, a tough and resilient seven-year-old boy, who is swinging a whiffle bat with unwavering determination at LENNY, a sniffly, chubby kid also seven years of age. Surprised to see his mother walk in alongside Mrs. Boswell, Evan decides to proceed with his playtime, choosing the company of Kayleigh, a sweet-natured, quiet girl of about the same age. Mrs. Boswell guides Andrea to the teacher's desk, where she opens the bottom drawer to reveal a drawing. The moment Andrea's eyes fall upon it, she freezes in shock; the drawing eerily depicts a child ominously holding a bloody knife while standing atop a heap of lifeless bodies, some disturbingly cut open to reveal their surprisingly anatomically correct insides.

Astounded and taken aback, Andrea looks at Evan, who is innocently playing with Lenny, appearing as harmless as can be, and she struggles to maintain control over her concern, visibly shaken by the revelation. Later on, Andrea escorts Evan into Dr. Redfield's office, where Evan is busily engaged in writing with focused attention in his new black-marble mead composition book. Meanwhile, Andrea converses into the phone while simultaneously pouring Lucky Charms cereal into a bowl meant for Evan. After completing the call, she walks into the adjacent room, retrieves her pocketbook from the coffee table, and heads back into the kitchen. To her shock and astonishment, she drops her purse upon seeing Evan standing there, expressionless, in the doorway, holding a large BUTCHER KNIFE by his side. Evan sees his mother yet remains expressionless, seemingly stunned to find himself grasping the knife, and subsequently, it falls from his hand.

Still deeply shaken by the incident, Andrea takes Evan to the house of GEORGE MILLER, a charming and athletic 35-year-old man with an infectious smile. He approaches the car with a friendly demeanor, courteously opening the door for Evan. With evident nervousness, Andrea hastily writes something on a piece of paper as Evan exits the vehicle. Evan responds with a nod, raises his arms straight up in the air, and heads inside. Within the confines of the rec-room/basement, the focus shifts to Miller's camera lens and eventually to Kayleigh, whose ashen face shows a slight trembling. Panic unmistakably begins to spread across Evan's face. Dr. Redfield then leads Evan inside, where he takes a seat at a long rectangular table, his eyes intently fixated on the opposite door. At last, through the opaque glass, a dark silhouette becomes visible; JASON, a thirty-year-old man with a haggard appearance, enters the room. Evan's eyes are now firmly fixed on the leg-restraints and handcuffs that severely hinder Jason's movements.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Fatigue grips him heavily, yet he perseveres in writing, his hand moving across the page with determination despite the weight of exhaustion. Meanwhile, outside in the sunlit driveway, 7-year-old Evan energetically engages with CRICKETT, a lively, frisky cocker spaniel puppy, his small hands reaching out to pet its soft fur while laughter spills from his lips. Nearby, Andrea, dressed in a mechanic's jumpsuit, works intently on the carburetor of a Toyota Celica, her brow furrowed with impatience as she grapples with the stubborn machinery. Evan pauses in his play, his eyes darting between the dog and his mother, observing as she struggles to turn a bolt that refuses to set the carburetor properly. He watches with an impatient curiosity, then, with a sudden decision, he blows his mother a kiss, a gesture of affection, before turning on his heel and sprinting toward the school, his small legs carrying him swiftly away. As Andrea watches him disappear, she moves to leave but is momentarily halted by the tapping of MRS. BOSWELL, 35, on her car window, prompting her to roll it down for a brief exchange. Inside the school, chaos reigns with the classroom filled with the sounds of children screaming and running, a whirlwind of youthful energy, as Mrs. Boswell enters with Andrea, her presence cutting through the tumult. Her voice rises above the din, calling out to TOMMY, a tough seven-year-old, who menacingly wields a whiffle bat at LENNY, now seven, a chubby child with a sniffle and a timid demeanor. Evan, momentarily surprised to see his mother with Mrs. Boswell, nonetheless resumes his play with Kayleigh, a sweet-looking, quiet girl of his age, the innocence of their interaction a stark contrast to the surrounding chaos. Mrs. Boswell guides Andrea to the teacher's desk, where she opens the bottom drawer and extracts a drawing, presenting it to Andrea. Andrea's expression hardens, turning to stone as her eyes absorb the shocking image of a child holding a bloody knife amidst a heap of dead bodies, some with disturbingly anatomically correct insides cut open. Her gaze shifts to Evan, who is innocently playing with Lenny, harmless in his demeanor, and she struggles to maintain her composure, visibly shaken by the implications of the drawing. Andrea, a knot of concern tightening in her chest, leads Evan into Dr. Redfield's office, where he sits absorbed, writing diligently in his new black-marble Mead composition book. Simultaneously, Andrea speaks into the phone, her voice a steady stream of conversation as she pours Lucky Charms into a bowl for Evan, the clinking of cereal against porcelain punctuating her words. She finishes the call, hangs up, and strides into the next room, her hand swiftly grabbing her pocketbook off the coffee table. As she walks back into the kitchen, her forward momentum halts abruptly, her purse slipping from her fingers in shock as her eyes land on Evan, standing in the doorway, his face blank, an expression of unsettling neutrality. In his small hand, he clutches a large butcher knife at his side, the sight freezing Andrea in place. Evan sees her, his face maintaining a veneer of expressionlessness, yet behind his eyes, he appears stunned by the realization of the knife in his hand, leading him to release it, the heavy clang of metal on the floor reverberating through the room. Still reeling from the encounter, Andrea escorts Evan to the home of GEORGE MILLER, 35, a man of athletic build and infectious smile, who approaches the car warmly and opens the door for Evan, welcoming him inside. As Evan steps out, Andrea, seated in the driver's seat, scribbles nervously on a piece of paper, her pen moving quickly over the paper as Evan nods in understanding, his small arms shooting straight up into the air, a gesture of readiness. Once inside the rec-room/basement, the lens of Miller's camera captures the scene, eventually focusing on Kayleigh, whose face, pale and trembling slightly, reflects a deep-seated unease. Panic etches itself onto Evan's face, his emotions laid bare as Dr. Redfield leads him into another room with a long rectangular table at its center. Evan takes a seat, his gaze fixed unwaveringly on the door across the room, anticipation coiling in his belly. Through the opaque glass, a dark figure materializes, gradually gaining definition until JASON, thirty and worn by life, steps into view, his movements constrained by the leg-restraints and handcuffs that bind him, a sight that captures and holds Evan's attention, his eyes tracing the lines of confinement that hold another's struggle within their grasp.

test_cases.description: Overcome with fatigue, he continues writing. In the driveway, 7-year-old Evan plays with CRICKETT, a frisky cocker spaniel puppy, while Andrea, dressed in a mechanic's jumpsuit, works on the Toyota Celica's carburetor. Evan, after blowing his mother a goodbye kiss, runs into the school where chaos reigns as Mrs. Boswell, 35, enters with Andrea. Surprised to see his mother arrive, Evan resumes playing with Kayleigh, a quiet, sweet-looking girl. Mrs. Boswell shows Andrea a disturbing drawing from the teacher's desk, causing Andrea to panic internally. She sees Evan innocently playing with Lenny and tries to control her growing concern. Andrea takes Evan to Dr. Redfield's office, where he writes in his new black-marble mead comp book while she speaks into the phone, prepares his cereal, and retrieves her pocketbook. Shocked, she drops her purse upon seeing Evan expressionless and holding a butcher knife, which he then drops in apparent confusion. Shaken, Andrea drops Evan off at GEORGE MILLER's house, a charming and athletic man who welcomes Evan. Andrea, writing nervously as Evan exits the car, observes him stepping out with his arms raised. In the basement rec-room, Evan, now panicked, is led by Dr. Redfield to a seat at a long table, staring intensely at the door. Finally, JASON, thirty and haggard-looking, appears through the opaque glass, his movements restricted by leg-restraints and handcuffs, capturing Evan's anxious attention.

Andrea, wearing a mechanic's jumpsuit reminiscent of those worn in bustling auto repair shops, works impatiently on the carburetor of a Toyota Celica, a popular compact sports car from the 1980s and '90s, as Evan pets the dog and watches his mother work. Evan sees her but remains expressionless, seems stunned to find himself holding the knife, and drops it, the clatter echoing in the silence. test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: Fatigue overwhelms him but he continues writing. In the driveway 7yearold Evan plays with CRICKETT a frisky cocker spaniel puppy. Andrea wearing a mechanic's jumpsuit works impatiently on the carburetor of a Toyota Celica as Evan pets the dog and watches his mother work. Evan impatiently watches Andrea turn the bolt but the carburetor will not set properly. Evan blows Andrea a kiss goodbye and runs into the school. As Andrea pulls away MRS BOSWELL 35 taps the car window. The classroom is filled with screaming running children when Mrs Boswell enters with Andrea and immediately calls out to TOMMY a tough sevenyearold kid who swings a whiffle bat at LENNY now seven a sniffling chubby kid. Evan is surprised to see his mother enter with Mrs Boswell but continues playing with Kayleigh now seven a quiet sweetlooking girl. Mrs Boswell leads Andrea over to the teacher's desk opens the bottom drawer and pulls out a drawing. Andrea turns to stone when she sees it. the drawing shows a child holding a bloody knife while standing on a heap of dead bodies and some of the corpses have been cut open with surprisingly anatomically correct insides. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Andrea sees Evan playing with Lenny harmless as a bunny and struggles to control her concern visibly shaken. now Andrea leads Evan into Dr Redfield's office where Evan busily writes in his new blackmarble mead comp book. Meanwhile Andrea speaks into the phone as she pours Lucky Charms into a cereal bowl for Evan hangs up walks into the next room grabs the pocketbook off the coffee table and heads back into the kitchen dropping her purse in shock when she sees Evan in the doorway expressionless and holding a large BUTCHER KNIFE by his side. Evan sees her but remains expressionless seems stunned to find himself holding the knife and drops it. Andrea still shaken drops Evan off at the house of GEORGE MILLER 35 a handsome athletic man with an infectious smile who approaches the car and opens the door for Evan. Andrea writes nervously on a piece of paper as Evan gets out and Evan nods and sticks his arms straight up in the air. The recroombasement Miller's camera lens and finally to Kayleigh whose ashen face trembles slightly. Panic spreads across Evan's face. Dr Redfield leads Evan inside where Evan takes a seat at a long rectangular table his eyes fixated on the door on the other side of the room. Finally a dark figure can be seen through the opaque glass. JASON thirty and haggardlooking enters the room as Evan's eyes fixate on the legrestraints and handcuffs that hinder Jason's movement.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Laziness inundates the cat, but it keeps napping. In the attic, 12-year-old Sarah builds with LEGO, a timid Siamese kitten. Brian, dressed in a chef's hat, paints meticulously on the exterior of a Honda Civic as Sarah strokes the kitten and observes her father illustrate. Sarah lazily observes Brian adjust the knob, but the paintbrush will not land accurately. Sarah tosses Brian a wink goodbye and sneaks into the gym. As Brian drives away, MR. THOMPSON, 50, kicks the bike pedal. The library is packed with whispering, studying teens when Mr. Thompson enters with Brian and promptly yells towards LUCY, a fearless twelve-year-old girl who juggles a rubber ball at TONY, now twelve, an anxious, skinny boy. Sarah is puzzled to see her father enter with Mr. Thompson but continues drawing with Emma, now twelve, a cheerful, energetic-looking child. Mr. Thompson leads Brian over to the librarian's stand, opens the top shelf, and extracts a photograph. Brian turns to jelly when he examines it; the photo shows a teenager clutching a rusty sword while climbing on a hill of ruined robots, and several of the machines have been dismantled with surprisingly intricate mechanical interiors. Brian sees Sarah drawing with Tony, meek as a lamb, and wrestles to hide his worry, visibly unnerved now. Brian guides Sarah into Dr. Green's workshop where Sarah diligently reads in her new red-leather sketch diary. Meanwhile, Brian speaks into the laptop as he pours Cocoa Puffs into a salad bowl for Sarah, logs off, wanders into the adjacent space, snatches the backpack off the recliner, and returns into the study, dropping his duffel in disbelief when he spots Sarah, in the hallway, expressionless and clutching a large BASEBALL BAT by her side. Sarah notices him but stays expressionless, seems startled to find herself grasping the bat, and lets it fall. Brian, still unnerved, takes Sarah to the barn of LUCAS CARTER, 45, a charming artistic woman with a captivating laugh, who approaches the scooter and opens the trunk for Sarah. Brian scribbles nervously on a map as Sarah climbs out, and Sarah salutes and sticks her arms straight out to the sides. The attic/gallery. Carter's magnifying glass and ultimately to Emma, whose pale hands quiver slightly. Alarm spreads across Sarah's face. Dr. Green guides Sarah inside, where Sarah takes a stand at a short round podium, her gaze locked on the window on the opposite side of the space. Eventually, a bright silhouette can be distinguished through the tinted glass; EMMA, forty and weary-looking, steps into the space as Sarah's gaze locks on the earphones and wristbands that limit Emma’s steps.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Evan, a 7-year-old boy, plays in the driveway with his puppy CRICKETT while his mother Andrea works on a car. As Andrea drives away, MRS. BOSWELL taps on her car window. In a chaotic classroom, Mrs. Boswell shows Andrea a disturbing drawing of a child with a bloody knife, shocking her. Concerned, Andrea takes Evan to Dr. Redfield's office, where Evan writes in his notebook. Later, Andrea finds Evan holding a butcher knife, which he drops, appearing stunned. Andrea, still shaken, drops Evan at GEORGE MILLER's house. In a tense moment, Evan enters a room guided by Dr. Redfield, watching as JASON, restrained by leg-restraints and handcuffs, enters.
